bugs.title: milkytracker: Multiple flaws in module loaders potentially leading to remote code execution

bugzilla.short_desc: milkytracker: Multiple flaws in module loaders potentially leading to remote code execution

long_desc.thetext:
MilkyTracker through version 1.01 is vulnerable to multiple issues in various module loaders that could potentially lead to remote code execution.

Upstream Issue:

https://github.com/milkytracker/MilkyTracker/issues/35

Upstream Patch:

https://github.com/milkytracker/MilkyTracker/commit/6f7922616f31e5ceddd6f346cfc7f5d61a2f7683

Created milkytracker tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1545502]

This should now be fixed in git for f26, f27 and master.

Updates for F26 and F27 are at 
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-2331a462fb
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-7d90e269a4

In the RPM package changelog I accidentally had inserted an incorrect upstream issue number (15 instead of 35). When I noticed this the packages were already pushed and built.
milkytracker-1.01.00-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

long_desc.thetext:
MilkyTracker through version 1.01 is vulnerable to multiple issues in various module loaders that could potentially lead to remote code execution.

Upstream Issue:

https://github.com/milkytracker/MilkyTracker/issues/35

Upstream Patch:

https://github.com/milkytracker/MilkyTracker/commit/6f7922616f31e5ceddd6f346cfc7f5d61a2f7683

Created milkytracker tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1545502]

This should now be fixed in git for f26, f27 and master.

Updates for F26 and F27 are at 
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-2331a462fb
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-7d90e269a4

In the RPM package changelog I accidentally had inserted an incorrect upstream issue number (15 instead of 35). When I noticed this the packages were already pushed and built.
milkytracker-1.01.00-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1545501,1545502

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
milkytracker-1.01.00-1.fc27 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 27. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-2331a462fb
milkytracker-1.01.00-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-7d90e269a4

milkytracker-1.01.00-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-7d90e269a4

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by muep.
This update has been pushed to testing.

Works for me, so planning to push this as soon as the mandatory waiting period ends.  Still would be good to have someone else test this and https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-7d90e269a4
This update has reached 7 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
